climbs.name: Vice Lord
climbs.fa: Reed Ames, Pete Scollan, Kim Dang

content.description: This route start 5 feet to the right of Clothing Optional. It is not in the picture topo.
content.protection: 4 bolts and 2 bolt anchor with Mussy Hooks. Lower off.
content.location: Starts 5 feet right of Clothing Optional. 2nd route rom the right at the president's area.

content.description:
Patina edges down low gain a ledge with a block and the crux, which is getting atop the block without cheating out right. Once atop the block step across onto the adjoining face and finish up past one more bolt to anchors.

* Easiest to have someone follow this after leading as cleaning it on the way down is more trouble than it's worth.
content.protection:
4 bolts, sport anchors (shared with

Vice Lord

)

* The 2nd bolt is currently doubled
content.location:
Located 15 feet left of

Go with the Flow

.

content.description:
This route might be slightly easier than its neighbor to the left.

This route was bolted by Jay on the first day of Obama's presidency.
content.protection: Bolts and two bolt anchor. Shares anchor with The President.
content.location: On the right side of a dark north facing wall that sits below Sidewinder and across the valley from The Owl.

content.description:
This is route number 5 on the picture topo. Located on the far right side of the president's ceag, this route traverses up and right.

To reduce rope drag, it may be helpful to back clean (unclip) the first bolt after you have clipped the second bolt.
content.location: Far right side of presidents crag. Located across the valley from the Owl.

content.description:
A thin start gains progressively easier climbing higher that parallels

Go with the Flow

for the last stretch to the anchors.
content.protection:
TR from the anchors of

Go with the Flow
content.location: Climbs the face directly below the anchors of "Go with the Flow".

content.description:
Thus is number 3 on the picture topo. Wide crack to the left of Clothing Optional. Can lead with gear to 5" or can top-rope from the same anchor as Clothing Optional.

It's nice to TR this after climbing Clothing Optional.  If you climb them back to back, it almost feels like you've climbed a whole route. Classic!
content.protection: Gear to 5" or top rope. Two bolt anchor with mussy hooks. Lower off.
content.location: 10 feet to the left of clothing optional. Wide crack. Lower off the anchor.

content.description:
Fun climb with plenty of features within the offwidth for smaller pro. Gear anchor with a walk-off involving a bit of 5.0 downclimbing. There might be a better walk-off if you explore the top of the formation more.

PS

I don’t know if this line has been climbed before. But there was nothing in the guidebook or on MP and with the descent off the formation being awkward, I’m not sure. Feel free to comment if it was established prior. Stuck with Presidents Crag for the name.
content.location: Obvious off width crack that splits the left-most formation of Presidents Crag.

content.description: This route is number 4 in the topo photo. Steep climbing with big holds. Climbs up the arete and moves left at the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts and two bolt mussy anchor. Lower off.
content.location: Sits directly across the valley from the Owl. This is route number 4 in the topo photo.

content.description: Move up and left and then back right at the top.
content.location: Dark, north facing wall with two sport route that go to same anchor. Left route on the wall.
